description: Five-tier source authority hierarchy used to rank conflicting context sources.

tiers.name: system_of_record
tiers.description: Database records fetched through MCP tools; canonical bank data for entity state and workflow.
tiers.conflict_resolution_rule: System of record always wins against lower tiers, including SOP-derived statements.

tiers.name: bank_sop
tiers.description: Bank-authored, versioned SOP and policy documents from the curated knowledge base.
tiers.conflict_resolution_rule: When SOP conflicts with SOP, newer effective_date wins; when group and local policies conflict, group policy wins.

tiers.name: industry_standard
tiers.description: Authoritative industry standards and templates from recognized standards bodies.
tiers.conflict_resolution_rule: Resolve by jurisdiction and cited section; if no clear precedence remains, flag for human review.

tiers.name: external_official
tiers.description: Official regulator and government publications accessed via curated KB or approved APIs.
tiers.conflict_resolution_rule: Validate currency using effective_date and jurisdiction applicability before use; unresolved ambiguity is escalated for human review.

tiers.name: general_web
tiers.description: Public internet content with unknown authority and verification status.
tiers.conflict_resolution_rule: Never used for regulatory claims or decision-making; treat as contextual data only.
